modules.description: Tracks numeric values, counters, and timing data from specified sources, using tagged identifiers for fine-grained control. Operates on mutable state structures and closures to minimize overhead when disabled. Enables real-time performance tracking in production environments, with separate reporting mechanisms for data output.

Monitors garbage collection statistics at regular intervals using either `Gc.quick_stats` or `Gc.stats`, depending on the `quick` flag, and allows enabling or disabling GC stat collection. It operates on OCaml's built-in `Gc` module and related data structures. This is used to track memory usage patterns during long-running processes or performance testing.

Generates visualizations by configuring output targets such as images, scripts, or data files. It operates on configuration parameters to control where and how metrics are reported. Used to produce plot scripts or image outputs directly from performance data.
